properties.name: ntfy
properties.description: Configuration group for ntfy.sh integration, enabling push notifications to mobile or desktop devices. Use this to receive real-time alerts about long-running agent tasks or errors on your phone.

children.name: enabled
children.description: Master switch to toggle ntfy.sh push notifications on or off. Set this to true to start sending notifications to the configured topic.

children.name: topic
children.description: The unique topic name used for your notifications on the ntfy server. Choose a sufficiently obscure or unique name to ensure privacy, as anyone subscribing to this topic will receive your alerts.

children.name: url
children.description: The base URL of the ntfy server to use. Defaults to the public 'https://ntfy.sh' service, but should be changed if you are running a self-hosted private ntfy instance.

properties.name: system
properties.description: Configuration group for native operating system desktop notifications (macOS/Linux). Controls local alerts displayed directly in your desktop environment.

children.name: levels
children.description: A list of severity levels (e.g., 'error', 'warning', 'info') that will trigger a desktop notification. Use this to filter out noise and only get alerted for critical issues or task completions.
